abstract: Leviathan, Golden Globe winner and Oscar-nominated Russian film, has polarized Russia ahead of its long-delayed release on Feb 5; critics applaud movie as realistic account of life in country in Putin era, but others demand it be banned as propaganda; few Russians have seen film.
lead_paragraph: The film has admirers and won a Golden Globe, but some Russian detractors want it banned and accuse its director of acting under Western orders.

byline.contributor: Alexandra Odynova and Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting.

snippet: The film has admirers and won a Golden Globe, but some Russian detractors want it banned and accuse its director of acting under Western orders.

headline.main: Russian Movie ‘Leviathan’ Gets Applause in Hollywood but Scorn at Home
headline.print_headline: Russian Movie Gets Applause in Hollywood but Scorn at Home
